data.name: Answering questions about data with Lo-Dash - 1
data.description:
Lo-Dash is a great tool for answering questions about data. Below you'll find five records representing Lego Star Wars sets. (Data is from [this Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Lego_Star_Wars_sets)).

The purpose of this lesson is to learn some Lo-Dash methods. This Kata will cover `_.filter()`, `_.map()` and `_.maxBy()`.

```javascript
var data = [ {
    name: "Star Wars #1",
    set: "3340",
    minifigs: ["Emperor Palpatine", "Darth Maul", "Darth Vader"],
    year: 2000,
    pieces: 25
}, {
    name: "TIE Bomber",
    set: "4479",
    minifigs: ["TIE pilot"],
    year: 2003,
    pieces: 230
}, {
    name: "Imperial AT-AT",
    set: "4483",
    minifigs: ["Luke Skywalker", "AT-AT driver", "Snowtrooper"],
    year: 2003,
    pieces: 1064
}, {
    name: "AT-AT",
    set: "75054",
    minifigs: ["General Veers", "AT-AT driver", "Snowtrooper Commander", "Snowtrooper"],
    year: 2014,
    pieces: 1138
}, {
    name: "Rebel Snowspeeder",
    set: "4500",
    minifigs: ["Luke Skywalker", "Dak Ralter", "Rebel Hoth trooper"],
    year: 2004,
    pieces: 214
} ];
```

Your job is to answer questions about the data. You will write 3 functions that accept one parameter each--the `data` as defined above--and return the respective answer to the following questions:

1. Which sets were released on 2003?
1. What set numbers belong to sets that contain a Luke Skywalker minifigure?
1. What is the name of the set with the most pieces?

See the initial code for examples of return values. See the [Lo-Dash API Reference](http://devdocs.io/lodash/index) for more information on how to use `_.filter()`, `_.map()` and `_.maxBy()`.
